trans-unit.target:
USAGE: /nameplatedisp [category] [setting number]
→Change PC display name settings.
>>Category: All Players <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>all<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Your Character <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>self<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Party Members <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Other PCs <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>other<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Friends <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>friend<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Crystalline Conflict Opponents <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>feast<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
>>Setting Number 1: Always 2: During Battle 3: When Targeted 4: Never
>>Example: /nameplatedisp all 4 (Set display names to never display for all players.)<tab><tab><tab>/nameplatedisp<tab>

ALIASES: /petglamour, /petglam, /egiglamour USAGE: /petglamour [summon] [glamour]
→Alter the appearance of select summons. You must resummon the egi for the glamour to take effect. Command not applicable in PvP instances.
>>Summon Name: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Garuda-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Titan-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ifrit-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Eos<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
>>Glamour: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Emerald Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Topaz Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ruby Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Garuda-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Titan-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ifrit-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Selene<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
The glamour will be removed when no glamour is specified. Displays pet glamour settings in chat log when no subcommand is specified.
>>Example: /petglamour "Garuda-Egi" "Ruby Carbuncle" (Garuda-Egi will appear glamoured as Ruby Carbuncle.) /petglamour "Garuda-Egi" (Returns Garuda-Egi to default appearance.) /petglamour (Displays pet glamour settings.)<tab>/petglamour<tab>/petglam<tab>/petmirage<tab>

USAGE: /rclickpc [subcommand]
→Sets right-click selection to allow or ignore PC targets.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>on <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Disables right-click selection for PCs. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>off <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Enables right-click selection for PCs.
Toggles between on and off when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/rclickpc<tab>

USAGE: /rclickbattlenpc [subcommand]
→Sets right-click selection to allow or ignore battle NPC targets.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>on <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Disables right-click selection for battle NPCs. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>off <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Enables right-click selection for battle NPCs.
Toggles between on and off when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/rclickbattlenpc<tab>

USAGE: /rclickminion [subcommand]
→Sets right-click selection to allow or ignore minion targets.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>on <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Disables right-click selection for minions. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>off <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Enables right-click selection for minions.
Toggles between on and off when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/rclickminion<tab>

ALIASES: /enemysign, /marking, /mk USAGE: /enemysign [sign type] [placeholder]
→Set a sign on the specified target. Uses current target when not specified.
>>Sign Types: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>attack1-8<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>bind1-3<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>ignore1-2<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>circle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>cross<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>square<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>triangle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var> off<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>/<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>clear<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Turns off sign.
Opens and closes the Signs menu when no subcommand is specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.
>>Example: /marking attack2 <t> (Assigns "Target to Attack 2" to target.)<tab>/enemysign<tab><tab>/marking<tab>/mk

ALIASES: /waymark, /wmark USAGE: /wmark [subcommand] [placeholder]
→Place a waymark on the ground below a target. If no target is specified, you will enter ground targeting mode ready to place a waymark.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>a <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark A. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>b <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark B. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>c <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark C. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>d<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark D. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>1<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark 1. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>2<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark 2. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>3<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark 3. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>4<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark 4. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var> off<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>/<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>clear<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Remove all waymarks. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>save 1-30<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Save waymark placements to slots 1-30 of the Waymarks menu. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>preset 1-30<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Load waymark placements from slots 1-30 of the Waymarks menu.
You will enter ground targeting mode ready to place an unused waymark in the order of A-D, 1, 2 when no subcommand is specified. More than six waymarks cannot be placed at one time. If a target name is specified, a marker name must also be specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>, gtoff
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.
>>Examples: /waymark A (Enters ground targeting mode ready to place waymark A.)
/waymark A <t> (Places waymark A at the selected target's location.)
/waymark A gtoff (Places waymark A at the mouse cursor's location.)<tab>/waymark<tab>/wmark<tab>/waymark<tab>/wmark

ALIASES: /grouppose, /gpose USAGE: /gpose
→Pose as a group.
>>Controls Open the Camera Settings interface <var 1E 0B /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((r)) ((R)) /var>, NUM*, Mouse Wheel
Toggle group view on camera <var 1E 0C /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((spacebar)) ((Spacebar)) /var>
Toggle camera lighting <var 1E 0E /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((x)) ((X)) /var>
Toggle all character motions <var 1E 0F /var>, 1 Key
Toggle target character motions <var 1E 10 /var>, 2 Key
Change focus of camera <var 1E 07 /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((tab,shift+tab)) ((Tab,Shift+Tab)) /var>
Adjust frame composition <var 1E 15 /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((w,a,s,d,q,e)) ((W,A,S,D,Q,E)) /var>
Reset frame composition <var 12 11 /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((z)) ((Z)) /var><tab><tab><tab>/grouppose<tab>/gpose

ALIASES: /idlingcamera, /icam USAGE: /icam [placeholder]
→Activate the idling camera. Target does not need to be specified. If a target is specified, the camera will switch between camera angles focusing on that target. If the specified target cannot be focused on, then a random subject will be chosen.
>>Controls Open the Camera Settings interface <var 1E 0B /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((r)) ((R)) /var>, NUM*, Wheel Button
Pause/unpause camera <var 1E 09 /var>, NUM0, left-click
Skip scene <var 1E 07 /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((tab,shift+tab)) ((Tab,Shift+Tab)) /var>
Adjust frame composition <var 1E 15 /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((w,a,s,d,q,e)) ((W,A,S,D,Q,E)) /var>
Reset frame composition <var 12 11 /var>, <var 08 E4E94F04 ((z)) ((Z)) /var>
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/idlingcamera<tab>/icam

ALIASES: /egiglamour, /egiglam, /petglamour USAGE: /egiglamour [summon] [glamour]
→Alter the appearance of select summons. You must resummon the egi for the glamour to take effect. Command not applicable in PvP instances.
>>Summon Name: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Garuda-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Titan-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ifrit-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Eos<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
>>Glamour: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Emerald Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Topaz Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ruby Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Garuda-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Titan-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ifrit-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Selene<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

>>Example: /egiglamour "Garuda-Egi" "Ruby Carbuncle" (Garuda-Egi will appear glamoured as Ruby Carbuncle.) /petglamour "Garuda-Egi" (Returns Garuda-Egi to default appearance.) /petglamour (Displays pet glamour settings.)<tab>/egiglamour<tab>/egiglam<tab>/egiglamour<tab>

ALIASES: /additionalaction, /aaction USAGE: /aaction "action name" [subcommand]
A command previously believed to set the specified action as an additional action for your current gatherer class. ※This text command is no longer in use.<tab><tab><tab>/additionalaction<tab>/aaction

ALIASES: /generalaction, /gaction USAGE: /gaction "action name" [placeholder]
→Uses the specified general action on the specified target. If action uses ground targeting, then the action will be executed according to the specified placeholder. If no placeholder is specified, then you will enter ground targeting mode.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>, gtoff
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.
>>Examples: /gaction "Mount Roulette" (Executes the Mount Roulette.)
/gaction “Duty Action I” <t> (Executes a duty-specific action on the specified target.)<tab><tab><tab>/generalaction<tab>/gaction
ALIASES: /addpvpaction, /apa A command previously believed to set specified actions as additional PvP actions. ※This text command is no longer in use.<tab><tab><tab>/addpvpaction<tab>/apa

USAGE: /autotarget [subcommand]
→Enable full auto-target.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>on <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Enable auto-target. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>off <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Disable auto-target.
Toggle between on/off when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/autotarget<tab>

ALIASES: /eatchocolate, /choco USAGE: /eatchocolate [subcommand]
→Snack on Valentione's chocolate.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>motion<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Perform motion only.
Both text and motion will be displayed when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/eatchocolate<tab>/choco

USAGE: /frighten [subcommand]
→Attempt to appear menacing.
